law.catch_line: Being victim of human trafficking is affirmative defense to violation of chapter.
law.text: A person charged under this chapter, or charged with an offense which is not a violent crime as defined in KRS 17.165, may assert being a victim of human trafficking as an affirmative defense to the charge.
law.history: Created 2014 Ky. Acts ch. 70, sec. 2, effective July 15, 2014.
